fields.headline: Havoc
fields.bodyText: (85 mins, 18) Directed by Barbara Kopple; starring Anne Hathaway, Bijou Phillips, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Mike Vogel, Freddy Rodriguez This film is the story of rich, bored Los Angeles kids from the smart suburb of Pacific Palisades who revolt against their bourgeois backgrounds and their negligent parents through drugs, booze, rap music and consorting with streetwise blacks and dangerous Hispanic crack dealers in the barrio. Everything turns out for the worse both for the kids and the initially flattered Chicanos they play with; there's a certain fascination in seeing Anne Hathaway involved in such goings-on. The movie is intended to be a wake-up call for middle-class parents, but it's pitched at the level of that camp exploitation classic, Reefer Madness. The disappointment is the greater considering Havoc is the work of the great radical documentary director Barbara Kopple (who won an Oscar for Harlan County, U.S.A.) and is scripted by Stephen Gaghan who wrote the screenplays for Traffic and Syriana
